title: Microsoft Hyper-V Server 8 Beta (x64) - DVD (English)
description:
With Windows Server 8, Microsoft have concentrated more on virtualization and cloud-based applications.

On the virtualization front, we can expect Hyper-V 3.0, which gives the ability to perform multiple Live Migrations at the same time, increased scalability Ã¢â‚¬â€œ you can now run it on a host machine with a maximum of 160 logical processors (compared to Hyper-VÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s current support of 2) and 2TB of RAM (compared to Hyper-VÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s current support of 1TB). Windows Server 8 also packs a new virtual hard disk format (VHDX) that supports eight times the current 2TB size limitation that applies to Ã¢â‚¬ËœoldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ VHD files.

Coming to the Cloud front,Microsoft mentioned in the whitepaper that Windows Server 8 offers a Ã¢â‚¬Å“private cloud solutionÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. This optimized cloud functionality that Microsoft states comes with new various features. For example, identity federation with AD FS, which assists with cross-premisesscalability and management capabilities of multi-server deployments were also touted.

Lots of improvements in place,so you can check out the 92 page product whitepaper Microsoft provided for a nice overview of the many new features and changes in Windows Server 8.

You may grab the bits officially through MSDN or Microsoft TechNet.
